1.verse: Paul, an apostle ( A ) of Christ Jesus by the will of God, ( B ) in keeping with the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus, ( C )

2.verse: To Timothy, ( D ) my dear son: ( E )

3.verse: I thank God, ( G ) whom I serve, as my ancestors did, with a clear conscience, ( H ) as night and day I constantly remember you in my prayers. ( I )

4.verse: Recalling your tears, ( J ) I long to see you, ( K ) so that I may be filled with joy.

5.verse: I am reminded of your sincere faith, ( L ) which first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice ( M ) and, I am persuaded, now lives in you also.

6.verse: For this reason I remind you to fan into flame the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands. ( N )

7.verse: For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, ( O ) but gives us power, ( P ) love and self-discipline.

8.verse: So do not be ashamed ( Q ) of the testimony about our Lord or of me his prisoner. ( R ) Rather, join with me in suffering for the gospel, ( S ) by the power of God.

9.verse: He has saved ( T ) us and called ( U ) us to a holy life—not because of anything we have done ( V ) but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time,

10.verse: but it has now been revealed ( W ) through the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, ( X ) who has destroyed death ( Y ) and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.

11.verse: And of this gospel ( Z ) I was appointed ( AA ) a herald and an apostle and a teacher. ( AB )

12.verse: That is why I am suffering as I am. Yet this is no cause for shame, ( AC ) because I know whom I have believed, and am convinced that he is able to guard ( AD ) what I have entrusted to him until that day. ( AE )

13.verse: What you heard from me, ( AF ) keep ( AG ) as the pattern ( AH ) of sound teaching, ( AI ) with faith and love in Christ Jesus. ( AJ )

14.verse: Guard ( AK ) the good deposit that was entrusted to you—guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us. ( AL )

15.verse: You know that everyone in the province of Asia ( AM ) has deserted me, ( AN ) including Phygelus and Hermogenes.

16.verse: May the Lord show mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, ( AO ) because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed ( AP ) of my chains. ( AQ )

17.verse: On the contrary, when he was in Rome, he searched hard for me until he found me.

18.verse: May the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that day! ( AR ) You know very well in how many ways he helped me ( AS ) in Ephesus. ( AT )

1.verse: You then, my son, ( A ) be strong ( B ) in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

2.verse: And the things you have heard me say ( C ) in the presence of many witnesses ( D ) entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.

3.verse: Join with me in suffering, ( E ) like a good soldier ( F ) of Christ Jesus.

4.verse: No one serving as a soldier gets entangled in civilian affairs, but rather tries to please his commanding officer.

5.verse: Similarly, anyone who competes as an athlete does not receive the victor’s crown ( G ) except by competing according to the rules.

6.verse: The hardworking farmer should be the first to receive a share of the crops. ( H )

7.verse: Reflect on what I am saying, for the Lord will give you insight into all this.

8.verse: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, ( I ) descended from David. ( J ) This is my gospel, ( K )

9.verse: for which I am suffering ( L ) even to the point of being chained ( M ) like a criminal. But God’s word ( N ) is not chained.

10.verse: Therefore I endure everything ( O ) for the sake of the elect, ( P ) that they too may obtain the salvation ( Q ) that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory. ( R )

11.verse: Here is a trustworthy saying: ( S )

14.verse: Keep reminding God’s people of these things. Warn them before God against quarreling about words; ( X ) it is of no value, and only ruins those who listen.

15.verse: Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth. ( Y )

16.verse: Avoid godless chatter, ( Z ) because those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly.

17.verse: Their teaching will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus ( AA ) and Philetus,

18.verse: who have departed from the truth. They say that the resurrection has already taken place, ( AB ) and they destroy the faith of some. ( AC )

19.verse: Nevertheless, God’s solid foundation stands firm, ( AD ) sealed with this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are his,” ( AE ) and, “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord ( AF ) must turn away from wickedness.”

20.verse: In a large house there are articles not only of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay; some are for special purposes and some for common use. ( AG )

21.verse: Those who cleanse themselves from the latter will be instruments for special purposes, made holy, useful to the Master and prepared to do any good work. ( AH )

22.verse: Flee the evil desires of youth and pursue righteousness, faith, love ( AI ) and peace, along with those who call on the Lord ( AJ ) out of a pure heart. ( AK )

23.verse: Don’t have anything to do with foolish and stupid arguments, because you know they produce quarrels. ( AL )

24.verse: And the Lord’s servant must not be quarrelsome but must be kind to everyone, able to teach, not resentful. ( AM )

25.verse: Opponents must be gently instructed, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth, ( AN )

26.verse: and that they will come to their senses and escape from the trap of the devil, ( AO ) who has taken them captive to do his will.

1.verse: But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days. ( A )

2.verse: People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, ( B ) boastful, proud, ( C ) abusive, ( D ) disobedient to their parents, ( E ) ungrateful, unholy,

3.verse: without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good,

4.verse: treacherous, ( F ) rash, conceited, ( G ) lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God—

5.verse: having a form of godliness ( H ) but denying its power. Have nothing to do with such people. ( I )

6.verse: They are the kind who worm their way ( J ) into homes and gain control over gullible women, who are loaded down with sins and are swayed by all kinds of evil desires,

7.verse: always learning but never able to come to a knowledge of the truth. ( K )

8.verse: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, ( L ) so also these teachers oppose ( M ) the truth. They are men of depraved minds, ( N ) who, as far as the faith is concerned, are rejected.

9.verse: But they will not get very far because, as in the case of those men, ( O ) their folly will be clear to everyone.

10.verse: You, however, know all about my teaching, ( P ) my way of life, my purpose, faith, patience, love, endurance,

11.verse: persecutions, sufferings—what kinds of things happened to me in Antioch, ( Q ) Iconium ( R ) and Lystra, ( S ) the persecutions I endured. ( T ) Yet the Lord rescued ( U ) me from all of them. ( V )

12.verse: In fact, everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted, ( W )

13.verse: while evildoers and impostors will go from bad to worse, ( X ) deceiving and being deceived. ( Y )

14.verse: But as for you, continue in what you have learned and have become convinced of, because you know those from whom you learned it, ( Z )

15.verse: and how from infancy ( AA ) you have known the Holy Scriptures, ( AB ) which are able to make you wise ( AC ) for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.

16.verse: All Scripture is God-breathed ( AD ) and is useful for teaching, ( AE ) rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness, ( AF )

17.verse: so that the servant of God  ( AG ) may be thoroughly equipped for every good work. ( AH )

1.verse: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who will judge the living and the dead, ( A ) and in view of his appearing ( B ) and his kingdom, I give you this charge: ( C )

2.verse: Preach ( D ) the word; ( E ) be prepared in season and out of season; correct, rebuke ( F ) and encourage ( G ) —with great patience and careful instruction.

3.verse: For the time will come when people will not put up with sound doctrine. ( H ) Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear. ( I )

4.verse: They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths. ( J )

5.verse: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, ( K ) do the work of an evangelist, ( L ) discharge all the duties of your ministry.

6.verse: For I am already being poured out like a drink offering, ( M ) and the time for my departure is near. ( N )

7.verse: I have fought the good fight, ( O ) I have finished the race, ( P ) I have kept the faith.

8.verse: Now there is in store for me ( Q ) the crown of righteousness, ( R ) which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day ( S ) —and not only to me, but also to all who have longed for his appearing. ( T )

9.verse: Do your best to come to me quickly, ( U )

10.verse: for Demas, ( V ) because he loved this world, ( W ) has deserted me and has gone to Thessalonica. ( X ) Crescens has gone to Galatia, ( Y ) and Titus ( Z ) to Dalmatia.

11.verse: Only Luke ( AA ) is with me. ( AB ) Get Mark ( AC ) and bring him with you, because he is helpful to me in my ministry.

12.verse: I sent Tychicus ( AD ) to Ephesus. ( AE )

13.verse: When you come, bring the cloak that I left with Carpus at Troas, ( AF ) and my scrolls, especially the parchments.

14.verse: Alexander ( AG ) the metalworker did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for what he has done. ( AH )

15.verse: You too should be on your guard against him, because he strongly opposed our message.

16.verse: At my first defense, no one came to my support, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them. ( AI )

17.verse: But the Lord stood at my side ( AJ ) and gave me strength, ( AK ) so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it. ( AL ) And I was delivered from the lion’s mouth. ( AM )

18.verse: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack ( AN ) and will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. ( AO ) To him be glory for ever and ever. Amen. ( AP )

19.verse: Greet Priscilla  and Aquila ( AQ ) and the household of Onesiphorus. ( AR )

20.verse: Erastus ( AS ) stayed in Corinth, and I left Trophimus ( AT ) sick in Miletus. ( AU )

21.verse: Do your best to get here before winter. ( AV ) Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia and all the brothers and sisters.

22.verse: The Lord be with your spirit. ( AW ) Grace be with you all. ( AX )
